intro: Baeumerta, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble bells, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Baeumerta thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its foliage is broad and glossy, adding ornamental value to gardens.
